metadata.title: CVE-2024-27039 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: clk:hisilicon: hi3559a: Fix an erroneous devm_kfree() 'p_clk' is an arrayallocated just before the for loop for all clk that need to be registered.It is incremented at each loop iteration. If a clk_register() call fails,'p_clk' may point to something different from what should be freed. Thebest we can do, is to avoid this wrong release of memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
